name: Free Shipping Threshold Optimization
description: Test hypothesis that raising free shipping threshold increases average order value without hurting conversion

inputs.featureIdea: Increase free shipping threshold from $50 to $75 to improve unit economics while maintaining conversion rate

expectedHypothesis.statement: We believe raising free shipping threshold from $50 to $75 for all customers will increase average order value to $64+ without decreasing conversion rate by more than 5%. We'll know we're right when AOV increases significantly and conversion rate stays within acceptable bounds.
assumptions: Customers will add items to reach new threshold
Conversion rate impact will be minimal (<5%)
Customer lifetime value won't be negatively impacted
risks: Conversion rate drops more than AOV gains (net negative revenue)

secondary: Percentage of orders with free shipping
counter: Order frequency (watch for decreased purchase frequency)

breakEvenScenario.description: AOV must increase to $64.20 to offset 5% conversion rate decrease while maintaining revenue

segmentationStrategy.note: Consider segmenting by customer lifetime value or order history

segments.name: Medium-value customers
segments.hypothesis: Most likely to add items to reach threshold

segments.name: Low-value customers
segments.hypothesis: At-risk segment - may experience conversion drop
